summary:
Designs oligonucleotide baits for hybrid selection reactions.

This tool is used to design custom bait sets for hybrid selection experiments. The following files are input into BaitDesigner: a (TARGET) interval list indicating the sequences of interest, e.g. exons with their respective coordinates, a reference sequence, and a unique identifier string (DESIGN_NAME).

The tool will output interval_list files of both bait and target sequences as well as the actual bait sequences in FastA format. At least two baits are output for each target sequence, with greater numbers for larger intervals. Although the default values for both bait size (120 bases) nd offsets (80 bases) are suitable for most applications, these values can be customized. Offsets represent the distance between sequential baits on a contiguous stretch of target DNA sequence.

The tool will also output a pooled set of 55,000 (default) oligonucleotides representing all of the baits redundantly. This redundancy achieves a uniform concentration of oligonucleotides for synthesis by a vendor as well as equal numbersof each bait to prevent bias during the hybrid selection reaction.

Usage example:

java -jar picard.jar BaitDesigner \
      TARGET=targets.interval_list \
      DESIGN_NAME=new_baits \
      R=reference_sequence.fasta

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: The desired offset between the start of one bait and the start of another bait for the same target.
arguments.name: --BAIT_OFFSET

arguments.summary: The length of each individual bait to design
arguments.name: --BAIT_SIZE

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: The name of the bait design
arguments.name: --DESIGN_NAME

arguments.summary: If true design baits on the strand of the target feature, if false always design on the + strand of the genome.
arguments.name: --DESIGN_ON_TARGET_STRAND

arguments.summary: The design strategy to use to layout baits across each target
arguments.name: --DESIGN_STRATEGY

options.summary: Implementation that "constrains" baits to be within the target region when possible.
options.name: CenteredConstrained

options.summary:
Design that places baits at fixed offsets over targets, allowing them to hang off the ends
 as dictated by the target size and offset.
options.name: FixedOffset

options.summary:
Ultra simple bait design algorithm that just lays down baits starting at the target start position
 until either the bait start runs off the end of the target or the bait would run off the sequence
options.name: Simple

arguments.summary: If true, fill up the pools with alternating fwd and rc copies of all baits. Equal copies of all baits will always be maintained
arguments.name: --FILL_POOLS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: The left amplification primer to prepend to all baits for synthesis
arguments.name: --LEFT_PRIMER

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: If true merge targets that are 'close enough' that designing against a merged target would be more efficient.
arguments.name: --MERGE_NEARBY_TARGETS

arguments.summary: The minimum number of baits to design per target.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_BAITS_PER_TARGET

arguments.summary: If true also output .design.txt files per pool with one line per bait sequence
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_AGILENT_FILES

arguments.summary: The output directory. If not provided then the DESIGN_NAME will be used as the output directory
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_DIRECTORY

arguments.summary: Pad the input targets by this amount when designing baits. Padding is applied on both sides in this amount.
arguments.name: --PADDING

arguments.summary: The size of pools or arrays for synthesis. If no pool files are desired, can be set to 0.
arguments.name: --POOL_SIZE

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: Baits that have more than REPEAT_TOLERANCE soft or hard masked bases will not be allowed
arguments.name: --REPEAT_TOLERANCE

arguments.summary: The right amplification primer to prepend to all baits for synthesis
arguments.name: --RIGHT_PRIMER

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: The file with design parameters and targets
arguments.name: --TARGETS

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Designs baits for hybrid selection!

name: BaitDesigner
